note.p: Death: St John's Court, Clerkenwell, London, England, Europe (17 March 1715)
Burial: The parish church of St James, Clerkenwell, London, England, Europe
Education: Marischal College, Aberdeen; MA (1657); Oxford

Career: Travelled in Holland and France (1664); Incumbent and benefactor of Saltoun, East Lothian (1664); Clerk of the Presbytery of Haddington (1667); Professor of Divinity, Glasgow University (1669); Chaplain to the Rolls Chapel, London (1675-1684); Lecturer at St Clement's; travelled to France, Italy and Switzerland (1683 and 1685); settled at The Hague on the invitation of William and Mary and returned to England with them; Bishop of Salisbury (1689)
Honours: Doctor of divinity from University of Oxford (1690s)
Committee appointments include: Committee for Collecting all the Phenomena of Nature hitherto observed (1664)
Other RSActivity: Proposed on 16 March 1664 and admitted on the same day he was elected.
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; ODNB
References: A Cook, 'Rome and the Royal Society, 1660-1740' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 3-19
Notes: DNB lists him under Burnet.
